frameDefinitions: An Item is attached by a Handle, via a Connector, to a Goal, or Items are attached to each other.
An Agent or Cause causes a Process or State to continue.
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
An Agent creates a Knot (possibly in a Place and/or with an Instrument).'
An Agent manipulates a Fastener to open or close a Containing_object (e.g. coat, jar).
An Agent manipulates a linear entity (the Rope) to form a Knot.
frameExamples: My thumb was <t>stuck</t> to the tube of glue.
The goaltenders <t>kept</t> the game going with terrific saves.
Loretta <t>ties</t> the most beautiful bowline I've ever seen.
Mary <t>closed</t> her coat with a belt.
Harry <t>tied</t> the rope into a slipknot.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Connector</fen> identifies the instrument used to attach and is usually expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.
<fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity that comes to be attached to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Items</fen> identifies the plural items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which the <fen>Item</fen>(s) is attached.
The individual who causes the <fen>Process</fen> to continue or the <fen>State</fen> to be maintained.
A <fen>Process</fen> that is maintained by the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>.
The <fen>State</fen> that is maintained by the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>.
An event that causes the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> to be maintained.
The time at which the <fen>Process</fen> continues.
The location at which the <fen>Process</fen> continues.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.
The stable configuration of a String which results from tying.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.

This role identifies the item that is closed by the agent with the fastener.
<fex name='Agent'>Lee</fex> <t>buttoned</t> <fex name='Containing_object'>his coat</fex>.
The Agent opens/closes the Containing-object.
This role identifies the fastener that the agent manipulates.
This role identifies the active zone of the container that may be expressed as the direct object of the target verb.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> closes the <fen>Container_portal</fen> or the <fen>Containing_object</fen>.
The location where the closing event takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient being who manipulates the <fen>Rope</fen>.
The basically linear object which is manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> to produce a <fen>Knot</fen>.
The stable configuration of a <fen>Rope</fen> which results from tying.
When the manipulation of the <fen>Rope</fen> takes place.
Where the manipulation of the <fen>Rope</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: The tarp is  tied down <fex>with a rope</fex>.
<fex>A handle</fex>  was affixed to the door.
<fex>The boats</fex> remained tied together.
The boat remained anchored <fex>to the coastline</fex>.
<fex>Smithers</fex> kept the food warm
The soot in the air  kept <fex>it</fex> <fex>raining</fex> for weeks
We need to keep <fex>China</fex> <fex>British</fex>.
<fex>The storm</fex> kept us in all the next day.
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.
<fex>Harry</fex> uncorked the champagne.
Marcus tied his shoe <fex>with the neon-green shoelaces</fex>.
We zipped <fex>the tent flap</fex>.
They close the bank vault <fex>at precisely 5:35PM</fex>.
Shouldn't you have buttoned that <fex>in the bathroom</fex>?
<fex>Melissa</fex> braided Jessica's hair.
He tied <fex>an electrical cable</fex> around the trunk and his neck before hanging himself .
Jake tied the cravat <fex>into an acceptable knot</fex>.
Terri tied the rope around her waist <fex>before scrambling up the side of the mountain</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the first half of the 19th century
the 'New Orphan House Ashley Down Bristol'
the Central School of Arts and Crafts
A Schole-House For The Needle of 1624
the second half of the 18th century
